actions.text: demo
Learner will be able to think of real-world problem that bothers her/him and think of possible solutions to be able to evaluate if their career choice will allow them to solve that problem or not

- Do a writing exercise
- Use Graphic Organizer to evaluate career and passion alignment
Dialogues | GROUP-A

funDoo loves stories of inspiration ‚úçÔ∏è especially if it relates to personal life! Would you like to know more? 
A. Yes, I would like to know 
B. No, I would not like to know now
No Problem! Let me ask you a question... üôÇ

Yaay! üòÉ 
You know, Sunderlal Bahuguna started the 'Chipko Movement'. Women from a village hugged trees to stop their cutting for commercial uses.

Are there issues you would like to solve, issues like potholes on the road/terrorism/global warming? 
A. Yes there are issues that bothers me
B. No, there aren't any
Yes, I understand that feeling ü§ù. Some real life problems can become our passion for life
That's totally fine. We are all different and hence think differently ü§ü This task is to find what real-world problem bothers you.

Let's find out what real-world problem brings out the leader in you through an activity. Are you ready? 
A. Yes I am ready
B. No I am not ready
Awesome!
<link to START no loop>

Great leaders are great because they believed that they can bring a change by solving real-world problems, and they have passion to do this.
 In this activity we will figure out what your passion is. 
All you need is üïõ 40 minutes for writing ‚úçÔ∏è and doing an activity.

Are you ready to do the activity? 
A. Yes I am ready for the activity
B. No I am not ready for the activity
That's great! Hope you are all set. Type OK to see the instructions
<link to Prepare threshold>

I am sharing a poster with a Graphic Organizer (where you organize your thoughts on a sheet).
Go through it and type DONE when you are ready for the task.

Graphic Organizer
What is your call (Passion or a Real-World Problem)

Problem (A larger world problem you are passionate to solve)

Why (Why are you eager to solve that problem, your reason)
What (What are you exactly solving/how people of the world or community will be affected by it)
How (How are you going to solve it? Write 1 or 2 possible solutions/innovation/methods/processes)

GREAT! Now, What is a large world problem, that you want to solve ‚úçÔ∏è
For example, funDoo is passionate about providing tips to every remote users and help them build skills.
Type it here -
Great! Tell me why are you passionate about this? Type your reason here -
Please type what are the effects of this problem.
Thanks! Now think and tell me what could be possible solutions to this problem. Type here -
Great job done! Thanks a lot for sharing
Here is a surprise for you. Type WHAT to see it
<<share giveaway>>
Here are your 30 U-Points

We have come to the last part of the task. We identified the problem, now let's look at your goal and summarise! 
Type OK to see instructions for the last part of this task

CREATIVE TEXT --

"Graphic Organizer
My Summary
career of your choice
(Write about the career you want to pursue)

Problem
(Write about the problem that bothers you and you want to solve)

Evaluate
The career that you have in mind, or written here, does the same career help you solve the problem written above?"

Here you go. Type SEEN after you have read it.

Graphic Organizer

My Summary 
(Write about the career you want to pursue)

Problem
(Write about the problem that bothers you and you want to solve)

Evaluate
Do you think the same career that you have in mind will be able to solve the problem that you want to solve)
So @contact.name, what is the career that you have chosen. Please type here -
Awesome! Now tell me what is the problem you have chosen. Please type here -
Lovely! Do you think the career option you chose will help you solve the problem you want to solve? Please type here -
Another surprise for you!! Type SEE to view it!
<<share giveaway>>

Congratulations on completing the task! Does your career option align with your purpose now?

A. Yes
B. No
So glad that you could align your career goal with your purpose ü§ó
Oh that's okay buddy ü§ó You can always choose to work towards your passion even if it isn't your career!

A larger goal or a reason to solve a problem gives a stronger purpose to life.
For example, my friend Jaspinder, who is passionate about helping people with health problems, has become a Nurse.

Aligning career goals with a problem gives bigger motivation. Now that you have both, your story will be equally inspiring to others.

It is alright to have passion and career as two different things, as long as one is working towards their passion, it will keep her/him motivated.
For example, my friend Sonam, who is an animal lover is connected with an NGO that feeds stray animals, and she is an engineer who works in a company. That way she is doing both.

Did you have fun doing this task? YES/NO
A. Yes, a lot!
B. Not much..
C. Not at all
Great  üòä
Oh! Thanks for letting us know  üòî
Oh! Thanks for letting us know üòî

Will you tell your friends to try this task? YES/NO/Maybe
A. Yes
B. Maybe
C. No
Great üòä
Oh! Thanks for letting us know üòî
Oh! Thanks for letting us know üòî

Thank you for your feedback! Would you like to try another task?

A. Yes! Let's do it!
B. No, I need a break..
Awesome. Let me fly you back to the menu! ‚úàÔ∏è
That's alright. Come back here and type *fundoo* when you want to try another task
